name: Avoid having multiple classes defined in a single file - Symfony STD (PHP)
description:
This QR will have violation if multiple classes are defined in a single file. 
Define one class per file - this does not apply to private helper classes that are not intended to be instantiated from the outside and thus are not concerned by the PSR-0 and PSR-4 autoload standards.
output:
This QR lists all the files thave multiple classes defined. It gives following information:
-PHP section full name
rationale: Maintainability is increased if a file contains a single class.
remediation: There should be one class in one file.
sample:
<?php 

                        Class Test 
                         { 
                              public function test() {}
                          } 
                            
                        Class Foo 
                         { 
                              public function foo() {}
                         } 
?>
